com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image

Class OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy.ExtendEdgesStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image.OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy.ExtendEdgesStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy
    Enclosing interface:
    OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy

    public static class OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy.ExtendEdgesStrategy
extends Object
implements OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy

    Accesses pixels beyond the edge of an image by assuming the edgemost pixels simply extend into infinity. As an example (note how the corners work): 

    
 0 1 2
 3 4 5
 6 7 8

    Input Image 

    
 0 0 0 1 2 2 2
 0 0 0 1 2 2 2
 0 0 0 1 2 2 2
 3 3 3 4 5 5 5
 6 6 6 7 8 8 8
 6 6 6 7 8 8 8
 6 6 6 7 8 8 8

    Extended Image

        public double get(int x,
         int y,
         int b,
         Image img)
        Description copied from interface: OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy
        Retrieves a value from an image when the value does not lay on the actual image itself.
        Specified by:
        get in interface OutOfBoundsAccessStrategy
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the desired pixel
        y - The y coordinate of the desired pixel
        b - The band containing the desired pixel
        img - The image to access
        Returns:
        A pixel value that represents the given coordinates
